alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Harnett; Sampson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 10 at 7:36PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Cumberland, Harnett and Sampson. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 734 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen since 7 PM. This is on top of heavy rainfall earlier this afternoon. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fayetteville, Dunn, Godwin, Hope Mills, Erwin, Eastover, Roseboro, Stedman, Wade, Salemburg, Falcon, Autryville, Linden, Vander, Cedar Creek, Bushy Lake Natural Area and Spivey`s Corner. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
